definition: (of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting

sentences.english: Time sure does fly when you are tarring over your lungs.
sentences.chinese: 当你肺里的焦油量逐渐增多，时间也在不断飞逝。

sentences.english: How time flied. Death god came to Ali.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，知道死神的到来。

sentences.english: once more: and oh, remember--time is flying, and only one of them is precious.
sentences.chinese: 噢，记住时间飞逝，而其中只有一件是珍贵的。

sentences.english: Time flies, and friends are scattered around.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，朋友四海为家。

sentences.english: One car after another is speeding by on the freeway.
sentences.chinese: 在高速公路上车子穿梭般地一辆接一辆飞逝而过。

sentences.english: The flown time appeared like dream in my declining memory.
sentences.chinese: 飞逝的时间向梦一样过去了。

sentences.english: Why am I so scared of that time goes away and can not be allowed stay with you everlastingly .
sentences.chinese: 为什么我总害怕时光飞逝而无法与你终生厮守？

sentences.english: How time flys , everybody isn't the one yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，每个人不像他在昨日。

sentences.english: How times have changed since then.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，十里洋场已经大变样儿了。

sentences.english: Time goes by quickly, we were waiting for today for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 时间飞逝，我们已翘首企盼今天这个日子好久了。

sentences.english: Time flew past with a whir of golden wings.
sentences.chinese: 时间的金色翅膀飕飕的飞逝过去了。

sentences.english: There is no way to stop the flight of time.
sentences.chinese: 时间的飞逝是无法阻挡的。

sentences.english: That I'm stuck here waitin', at times debatin'
sentences.chinese: 时间飞逝，我还是坐在这里，内心却在挣扎。

sentences.english: This grand little soul had taken its flight.
sentences.chinese: 这个伟大的小灵魂飞逝了。

sentences.english: See time flies, silent, this scene is ultimately I negative you.
sentences.chinese: 看流年飞逝，沉默不语，这场戏终究是我负了你。

definition: to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
the passage of the years/the flow of time
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
